short_description: Blank
long_description: Blank

short_description: Emergency
long_description: Emergency - The patient required immediate medical intervention as a result of severe, life threatening, or potentially disabling conditions. Generally, the patient was admitted through the emergency room.

short_description: Urgent
long_description: Urgent - The patient required immediate attention for the care and treatment of a physical or mental disorder. Generally, the patient was admitted to the first available and suitable accommodation.

short_description: Elective
long_description: Elective - The patient's condition permitted adequate time to schedule the availability of suitable accommodations.

short_description: Newborn
long_description: Newborn - Necessitates the use of special source of admission codes.

short_description: Trauma Center
long_description: Trauma Center - visits to a trauma center/hospital as licensed or designated by the State or local government authority authorized to do so, or as verified by the American College of Surgeons and involving a trauma activation.

short_description: Reserved
long_description: Reserved

short_description: Reserved
long_description: Reserved

short_description: Reserved
long_description: Reserved

short_description: Unknown
long_description: Unknown - Information not available.

short_description: Female
long_description: Female

short_description: Male
long_description: Male

short_description: Unknown
long_description: Unknown

short_description: Anomaly
long_description: ANOMALY: invalid value, if present, translate to '9'

short_description: Non-Health Care Facility Point of Origin (Physician Referral)
long_description: Non-Health Care Facility Point of Origin (Physician Referral) — The patient was admitted to this facility upon an order of a physician.

short_description: Clinic Referral
long_description: Clinic referral — The patient was admitted upon the recommendation of this facility's clinic physician.

short_description: HMO Referral
long_description: HMO referral — Reserved for national Prior to 3/08, HMO referral — The patient was admitted upon the recommendation of a health maintenance organization (HMO) physician.

short_description: Transfer from Hospital (different facility)
long_description: Transfer from hospital (Different Facility) — The patient was admitted to this facility as a hospital transfer from an acute care facility where he or she was an inpatient.

short_description: Transfer from Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF)
long_description: Transfer from a skilled nursing facility (SNF) or Intermediate Care Facility (ICF) — The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from a SNF or ICF where he or she was a resident.

short_description: Transfer from Another Health Care Facility
long_description: Transfer from another health care facility — The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from another type of health care facility not defined elsewhere in this code list where he or she was an inpatient.

short_description: Emergency Room
long_description: Emergency room — The patient was admitted to this facility after receiving services in this facility's emergency room department (CMS discontinued this code 07/2010, although a small number of claims with this code appear after that time).

short_description: Court/Law Enforcement
long_description: Court/law enforcement — The patient was admitted upon the direction of a court of law or upon the request of a law enforcement agency's representative.

short_description: Information Not Available
long_description: Information not available — The means by which the patient was admitted is not known.

short_description: Reserved for National Assignment
long_description: Reserved for National Assignment. (eff. 3/08) Prior to 3/08 defined as: Transfer from a Critical Access Hospital — patient was admitted/referred to this facility as a transfer from a Critical Access Hospital.

short_description: Transfer from Another Home Health Agency
long_description: Transfer from Another Home Health Agency — The patient was admitted to this home health agency as a transfer from another home health agency. (Discontinued July 1, 2010 — Reference Condition Code 47)

short_description: Readmission to Same Home Health Agency
long_description: Readmission to Same Home Health Agency — The patient was readmitted to this home health agency within the same home health episode period. (Discontinued July 1, 2010)

short_description: Transfer from hospital inpatient in the same facility resulting in a separate claim to the payer
long_description: Transfer from hospital inpatient in the same facility resulting in a separate claim to the payer — The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from hospital inpatient within this facility resulting in a separate claim to the payer.

short_description: Transfer from Ambulatory Surgical Center
long_description: Transfer from Ambulatory Surgical Center

short_description: Transfer from Hospice
long_description: Transfer from hospice and is under a hospice plan of care or enrolled in hospice program

Admitted as an inpatient to this hospital. In situations where a patient is admitted before midnight of the third day following the day of an outpatient service, the outpatient services are considered inpatient.
